intro: Notelaea posua, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a member of the Cyatheaceae family and is native to New Zealand. It is a tall, evergreen tree fern that can reach heights of up to 15 meters, with a trunk that is covered in fibrous, brownish scales. The plant has a distinctive crown of feather-like fronds that can grow up to 3 meters in length. Its roots form a dense network that helps stabilize the soil, making it ecologically significant in its native habitat. Notelaea posua is adapted to humid, temperate climates and thrives in well-drained, nutrient-rich soils.
